original: He listened, but heard nothing.

original: It was stupid for him to turn down her offer.
translated: Il a été stupide de rejeter son offre.

original: Algeria is not only against the State of Israel but against any Jewish entity. Of course Algeria hates not only Kabyles but everything that constitutes a smell of Kabylity.
translated: L'Algérie n'est pas seulement contre l’État d'Israël mais contre toute entité juive. Bien sûr, l'Algérie déteste non seulement les kabyles mais déteste tout ce qui constitue une odeur de kabylité.

original: The population of New York is smaller than that of Tokyo.
translated: La population de New-York est moins importante que celle de Tokyo.

original: Why are you touching my boyfriend?
translated: Pourquoi tripotez-vous mon petit ami ?

original: That's really all you need to know.

original: Jean looks at the roses.
translated: Jean regarde les roses.

original: I'm really sleepy.
translated: J'ai vraiment sommeil.

original: Do you work on Sundays?
translated: Travaillez-vous le dimanche ?

original: They've had plenty of time.
translated: Ils ont disposé de plein de temps.

original: I'll look after that child.
translated: Je surveillerai cet enfant.

original: Can you help me with my work?
translated: Peux-tu m'aider dans mon travail ?

original: I'll be back by six o'clock.
translated: Je reviens à six heures.

original: They cannot drive a car.
translated: Elles ne peuvent pas conduire une voiture.

original: I want to know who is in charge.

original: It's your bedtime.

original: Sami split up with his second wife.
translated: Sami a rompu avec sa seconde femme.

original: I'll try to help you.

translated: Il s'est balancé sur un rondin.

original: Answer Tom.

original: Whatever floats your boat.

original: Some of the girls laughed.
translated: Certaines des filles rirent.

original: Tom does nothing but read comics.
translated: Tom ne fait rien à part lire des bandes dessinées.

original: It was a waste of time for all of us.
translated: C'était une perte de temps pour nous tous.

original: I'm always happy.
translated: Je suis toujours heureux.

original: I wasn't here on Monday.
translated: Je n'étais pas là lundi.

original: He took a notebook out.
translated: Il a sorti un calepin.

original: The shop, the advertisement, traffic, all that commerce which constitutes the body of our world, was gone.
translated: Le commerce, la publicité, le trafic, tous ces échanges qui constitue le corps de notre monde, avait disparu.

original: That looks like it takes a lot of skill.
translated: On dirait que ça demande beaucoup d'habileté.

original: We live here.
translated: Nous vivons ici.

original: Will you come back tomorrow?
translated: Tu reviens demain ?

original: Garlic enhances the flavor of meals.
translated: L'ail renforce la saveur des plats.

original: Should I put on a tie?

original: Obviously he is wrong.

original: You'd better give up smoking.
translated: Vous feriez mieux d'arrêter de fumer.

original: Divide the cake among you three.
translated: Partagez le gâteau entre vous trois.

original: Wash before first wearing.
translated: Laver avant utilisation.

original: Am I supposed to thank you?
translated: Suis-je supposé te remercier ?

original: Poverty is the mother of all vices.
translated: La misère est la mère de tous les vices.

original: Let's hear your excuse.
translated: Écoutons votre excuse.

original: He needs a few jokes to lighten up his talk.
translated: Il a besoin de quelques plaisanteries pour alléger son discours.

original: They revolted against the government.
translated: Ils se révoltèrent contre le gouvernement.

original: I want to be in your life again.

original: Tatsuo likes looking at aircraft landing gears.
translated: Tatsuo aime regarder les trains d'atterrissage des avions.

original: I want to take it apart.

original: I think it's a wild goose chase.

original: Please pay attention.

original: You need to stay awake.

original: Are you sure that you haven't forgotten anything?

original: I don't think you can beat me.
translated: Je ne pense pas que tu puisses me battre.

original: She felt like crying.

original: It wasn't ours.

original: Do you think she's in trouble?

original: I think I'll look for another group that's more interesting to me.
translated: Je pense que je vais chercher un autre groupe plus intéressant pour moi.

original: I'd like a map of the city.

original: I thought the meeting had been canceled.
translated: Je pensais que la réunion avait été annulée.

original: Help yourself to these cookies.
translated: Sers-toi de ces biscuits.

original: I think that I've lost my umbrella.
translated: Je crois que j'ai perdu mon parapluie.

original: Leave a message.

original: It was my turn to straighten up the room.
translated: C'était mon tour de ranger la chambre.

original: I hate studying French.
translated: Je déteste étudier le français.

original: You're lucky to be alive.
translated: Tu es chanceux d'être en vie.

original: I like to write songs in French.
translated: J'aime écrire des chansons en français.

original: Would you be willing to share your code with me?
translated: Seriez-vous disposée à partager votre code avec moi ?

original: The weather is unusual today.
translated: Le temps est inhabituel, aujourd'hui.

original: You're no fun anymore.
translated: Vous n'êtes plus amusants.

original: Be a good boy.
translated: Sois un bon garçon !

original: I smell with my nose.
translated: Je sens avec mon nez.

original: Tom spoke French to me.
translated: Tom m'a parlé en français.

original: Where is the bus?
translated: Où est le bus ?

original: He chose his words carefully.
translated: Il a soigneusement choisi ses mots.

original: My orders are to go with you.
translated: Mes ordres sont d'aller avec vous.

original: Let's not do anything that might get us in trouble.
translated: Ne faisons rien qui pourrait nous causer des ennuis.

original: I would not miss it for anything.
translated: Je ne le raterais pour rien au monde.

original: Let's forget it.
translated: Oublions cela.

original: Everyone should go.
translated: Tout le monde devrait partir.

original: I think they like me.
translated: Je pense qu'elles m'apprécient.

original: Do you want to eat this?
translated: Voulez-vous manger ceci ?

original: I slept on the bus.
translated: J'ai dormi dans le bus.

original: The American anthropologist Margaret Mead once said that one should never underestimate what a small group of dedicated people can accomplish.
translated: L'anthropologiste étatsunienne Margaret Mead déclara un jour que l'on ne devrait jamais sous-estimer ce qu'un petit groupe de personnes dévouées peut accomplir.

original: What a cheek!
translated: Quelle insolence !

original: The girl doesn't like to play soccer.
translated: La fille n'aime pas jouer au football.

original: You aren't superstitious by any chance?
translated: Vous n'êtes pas superstitieux par hasard ?

original: We're in control.
translated: Nous contrôlons la situation.

original: Tom has a difficult job.
translated: Tom a un boulot compliqué.

original: Do you need the phone?
translated: Avez-vous besoin du téléphone ?

original: Over the years my mother lied to me about so many things.
translated: Au cours des années, ma mère m'a menti à propos de tant de choses.

original: I have a fear of the dark.
translated: J'ai peur de l'obscurité.

original: They forgave him for his crimes.
translated: Ils lui pardonnèrent ses crimes.

original: Christmas decorations were going up.
translated: Les décorations de Noël étaient en hausse.

original: What is it that you don't know?
translated: Qu'est-ce que tu ne sais pas ?

original: Dr. Bell treated the patient.
translated: Le docteur Bell a traité le patient.

original: You seem to know a lot about me.
translated: Vous semblez en savoir beaucoup à mon sujet.

original: We thought his threat was only a joke.
translated: Nous pensions que sa menace n'était qu'une plaisanterie.

original: How is your surname written?
translated: Comment écrit-on votre nom de famille ?

original: Tom and Mary exchanged Christmas gifts.
translated: Tom et Marie ont échangé des cadeaux de Noël.

original: Tom goes to school by bicycle.
translated: Tom va à l'école en vélo.

original: You shouldn't give up hope.
translated: Tu ne devrais pas abandonner l'espoir.

original: Am I correct in assuming you've finished doing what we asked you to do?
translated: Ai-je raison de penser que tu as fini de faire ce qu'on t'a demandé ?

original: Report to the emergency room.
translated: Rapportez à la salle d'urgence.

original: Do you love Tom?
translated: Êtes-vous amoureuse de Tom ?

original: His wealth has not made him happy.
translated: Sa fortune ne l'a pas rendu heureux.

original: I piss on the corpus.
translated: Je pisse sur le corpus.

original: The fruit went bad.
translated: Le fruit s'est avarié.

original: Milk is more nourishing than wine.
translated: Le lait est plus nourrissant que le vin.

original: Have you seen their new apartment?
translated: As-tu vu leur nouvel appartement ?

original: I can see that bothers you.
translated: Je vois bien que ça t'embête.

original: He turned over the business to his son.
translated: Il a légué l'entreprise à son fils.

original: I'm curious.
translated: Je suis curieux.

original: That's very nice of you to say.
translated: C'est très aimable de votre part de le dire.

original: The suspect is armed and dangerous.
translated: Le suspect est armé et dangereux.

original: I forced them to fix my car.
translated: Je les ai forcés à réparer ma voiture.

original: The choice is yours.
translated: C'est ton choix.

original: Tell me about him.
translated: Parle-moi de lui.

original: My sister washes her hair every morning.
translated: Ma sœur se lave les cheveux tous les matins.

original: I'd like you to look after my dog during my absence.
translated: J'aimerais que tu t'occupes de mon chien durant mon absence.

original: There are no hidden service charges.
translated: Il n'y a pas de frais de service cachés.

original: Yiddish is written with the Hebrew alphabet.
translated: Le yiddish s'écrit au moyen de l'alphabet hébraïque.

original: What is the name of that bird?
translated: Comment s'appelle cet oiseau ?

original: She got angry.
translated: Elle s'est mise en colère.

original: I don't think this is a good idea.
translated: Je ne pense pas que ce soit une bonne idée.

original: If your coffee is too strong, add some sugar.
translated: Si ton café est trop fort, ajoute du sucre.

original: That's not how it happened.
translated: Ce n'est pas comme ça que ça s'est passé.

original: Why are you sleeping?
translated: Pourquoi es-tu en train de dormir ?

original: I know how old you are.
translated: Je connais ton âge.

original: I go to school on a bus.
translated: Je vais à l'école en bus.

original: You're not alone.
translated: Vous n'êtes pas seul.

original: How could you say such a thing?
translated: Comment as-tu pu dire une telle chose ?

original: Be merciful.
translated: Soyez miséricordieux !

original: It makes no difference whether the train is delayed or not.
translated: Cela ne fait aucune différence si le train est retardé ou non.

original: Maybe we should go to Boston.
translated: Nous devrions peut-être aller à Boston.

original: Tom didn't want to kiss Mary.
translated: Tom n'a pas voulu embrasser Mary.

original: You reap what you sow.
translated: On ne récolte que ce que l'on a semé.

original: I like the light that candles emit.
translated: J'aime la lumière des bougies.

original: When do you practice the piano?
translated: Quand travaillez-vous votre piano ?

original: It gives me goosebumps.
translated: J’en ai la chair de poule.

original: Who's in command here?
translated: Qui commande ici ?

original: My father offered his services to a well-known trade company.
translated: Mon père a offert ses services à une société de négoce bien connue.

original: Tom said that he thought that Mary would be hungry.
translated: Tom a dit qu'il pensait que Mary aurait faim.

original: I wanted to go to Australia.
translated: Je voulais aller en Australie.

original: Let's remember that it was a man from this state who first carried the banner of the Republican Party to the White House, a party founded on the values of self-reliance and individual liberty and national unity. Those are values that we all share. And while the Democratic Party has won a great victory tonight, we do so with a measure of humility and determination to heal the divides that have held back our progress.
translated: Souvenons-nous que c'est un homme de cet État qui, le premier, a planté la bannière du parti républicain à la Maison-Blanche, un parti fondé sur les valeurs d'autonomie, de liberté individuelle et d'unité nationale. Valeurs que nous partageons tous. Et bien que le parti démocrate ait remporté cette nuit une grande victoire, c'est avec humilité et détermination que nous chercherons à guérir des divisions qui ont entravé notre progression.

original: Your English has improved a lot.
translated: Ton anglais s'est beaucoup amélioré.

original: Get out of my house!
translated: Sors de chez moi !

original: I'll leave the decision to you.
translated: Je vous laisserai la décision.

original: How long have you been in love with him?
translated: Depuis combien de temps es-tu amoureuse de lui ?

original: I don’t have enough cutlery for all my guests.
translated: Je n'ai pas assez de couverts pour tous mes invités.

original: Some students passed the exam, but others failed.
translated: Certains élèves ont réussi l'examen, mais les autres ont échoué.

original: What did they say?
translated: Qu'ont-ils dit ?

original: My older sister was grounded for coming home too late last night.
translated: Ma sœur aînée est privée de sorties pour être rentrée trop tard la nuit dernière.

original: When the long, hearty dinner was over, the guests began dancing and singing.
translated: Lorsque le long et consistant souper fut terminé, les invités se mirent à danser et à chanter.

original: I don't take after my father.
translated: Je ne tiens pas de mon père.

original: He often falls in love.
translated: Il tombe souvent amoureux.

original: You have to leave the hotel before eleven o'clock.
translated: Tu dois partir de l'hôtel avant onze heures.

original: He is nothing but a businessman.
translated: Il n'est qu'un simple homme d'affaires.

original: Bite the bullet.
translated: Serrez les dents.

original: Before matter (the universe) began to exist, there had to be a mind to conceive and organize it.
translated: Avant que la matière (l'univers) ne commence à exister, il fallait un esprit pour la concevoir et l'organiser.

original: We were prison guards for ten years.
translated: Nous fûmes gardiennes de prison pendant dix ans.

original: It's a world record.
translated: C'est un record du monde.

original: Tom has been kidnapped.
translated: Tom a été kidnappé.

original: I was happy to hear the news.
translated: J'étais heureux d'entendre les nouvelles.

original: I'm getting a new house built.

original: Can you still remember when we first met?

original: I don't want to be a burden to you.
translated: Je ne veux pas être un poids pour vous.

original: They're mad at you.

original: After your surgery, you must spend a few days in a spa town and recover in thermal springs.
translated: Après ton opération chirurgicale, tu dois passer quelques jours à une ville d'eau et te donner une cure thermale.

original: I didn't know that Mary was Tom's daughter.
translated: Je ne savais pas que Marie était la fille de Tom.

original: I think we may have something that you'd be interested in buying.
translated: Je pense que nous avons peut-être quelque chose que vous seriez intéressée d'acquérir.

original: Hello, I'm Nancy.

original: I know how to use this.
translated: Je sais comment utiliser ça.

original: The shirt needs ironing.
translated: Il faudrait repasser cette chemise.

original: I refused to pay.
translated: J'ai refusé de payer.

original: You're the teacher.
translated: C'est toi l'enseignante.

original: A man can no more become a woman than a monkey can develop into a man.
translated: Un homme ne peut pas devenir une femme pas plus qu'un singe ne peut se développer en homme.

original: Did you love Tom?

original: If you're not here by noon, I'll eat alone.
translated: Si tu n'es pas là à midi, je mangerai seul.

original: I wanted to be a journalist.
translated: Je voulais devenir journaliste.

original: How are you connected?
translated: Comment êtes-vous reliés ?

original: Do they know that we know?

original: I don't know if I can make it to your party or not.
translated: J'ignore si je peux assister à votre fête ou pas.

original: Were you on the train?

original: I will come, weather permitting.
translated: Je viendrai, si le temps le permet.

original: What did you expect to happen?

original: Tom started leaving.
translated: Tom s'est mis en route.

original: They lost.

original: He grinned at me.
translated: Il m'a fait un grand sourire.

original: They paid for their wine, and left the place.
translated: Ils payèrent pour leur vin et quittèrent l'endroit.

original: What's the minimum salary in Portugal?

original: See how they run!
translated: Vois comme elles courent !

original: Let's talk about this tomorrow.
translated: Parlons de ça demain.

original: It matters not how a man dies, but how he lives.
translated: Il n'importe pas comment un homme meurt, mais comment il vit.

original: You fix it.
translated: Tu répares.

original: Would you like to go fishing next weekend?
translated: Aimeriez-vous aller pêcher le week-end prochain ?

original: Tom misunderstood Mary.
translated: Tom a mal compris Marie.

original: Sing us a song.
translated: Chante-nous une chanson.

original: There's no going back.
translated: Il n'y a pas de retour possible.

original: He retired.
translated: Il a pris sa retraite.

original: He was at the wrong place at the wrong time.
translated: Il était au mauvais endroit, au mauvais moment.

original: Everybody always knows when the politicians do something wrong and how they should do it better, but only a tiny fraction of the population is ready to commit themselves to politics.
translated: Tout le monde sait toujours ce que les politiciens font de travers et comment ils devraient s'y prendre, mais seule une partie infime de la population est prête à s'engager elle-même en politique.

original: A student visited the house of the great playwright.
translated: Un étudiant visitait la maison du grand dramaturge.

original: Ow!
translated: Aïe !

original: She's younger than him.
translated: Elle est plus jeune que lui.

original: I'll find friends wherever I go.
translated: Je trouverai des amis où que je me rende.

original: I'll be gone until Sunday.
translated: Je serai absent jusqu'à dimanche.

original: Tom has been seeing a therapist.
translated: Tom voit un psychologue.

original: The parrot wakes up the cook early.
translated: Le perroquet réveille le cuisinier tôt.

original: There's nobody on this ship except us.
translated: Il n'y a personne sur ce bateau, à part nous.

original: I'll miss this place once I leave.
translated: Cet endroit me manquera, quand je serai partie.

original: I'm leaving in one minute.
translated: Je pars dans une minute.

original: And your parents? When do they arrive?
translated: Et tes parents ? Ils arrivent quand ?

original: Tom is in deep trouble.
translated: Tom est dans un sale pétrin.

original: Did you know there was a secret passage?
translated: Savais-tu qu'il y avait un passage secret ?

original: Wipe your eyes.
translated: Essuie-toi les yeux.

original: I started crying.
translated: Je me suis mise à pleurer.

original: I knew you had a boyfriend!
translated: Je savais que vous aviez un petit-ami !

original: He was propelled by a thirst for revenge.
translated: Il était mu par la soif de vengeance.

original: I gathered together my things and put them in my suitcase.
translated: J'ai rassemblé mes affaires et les ai placées dans ma valise.

original: They clapped.

original: Was that really worth it?

original: I don't think that it'll rain.
translated: Je ne pense pas qu'il va pleuvoir.

original: Could you pass me the salt, please?
translated: Pouvez-vous me passer le sel, s'il vous plaît ?

original: Your brilliant eyes are like the sun.
translated: Vos yeux brillants sont comme le soleil.

original: My pillow is so soft!
translated: Mon oreiller est si moelleux !

original: Mary is said to have been a great singer in her youth.
translated: On dit que Marie a été une grande chanteuse durant sa jeunesse.

original: I'm not a good artist.

original: They have black hair.

original: Have you seen the uncensored version?

original: He has four children to feed.
translated: Il a quatre enfants à nourrir.

original: I found a solution.

original: Who doesn't like the beach?

original: I know that I have a date, but I'm not sure who it's with.
translated: Je sais que j'ai un rencard, mais je ne suis pas sûr avec qui.

original: I'm going to buy a camera for my daughter.
translated: Je vais acheter un appareil photo pour ma fille.

original: She was in the habit of going for a walk before tea.
translated: Elle avait l'habitude de se promener avant le dîner.

original: The people were bruised and the cities were on their knees.
translated: Le peuple était meurtri, et les villes exsangues.

original: An I will give to thee, and to thy seed, the land of thy sojournment, all the land of Canaan, for a perpetual possession, and I will be their God.
translated: Et je donnerai à toi et à ta postérité la terre de tes pérégrinations, toute la terre de Canaan, comme possession indéfinie ; et je serai pour eux un Dieu tutélaire.

original: It's not all that ridiculous.
translated: Ce n'est pas si ridicule que cela.

original: The viper's tongue is never more venomous than when it is coated with honey.
translated: La langue de la vipère n’est jamais plus venimeuse que lorsqu’elle est enduite de miel.

original: When does school let out for the holidays?
translated: Quand l'école ferme-t-elle pour les congés ?

original: She's right here.
translated: Elle est juste là.

original: My wife works part time.
translated: Ma femme travaille à temps partiel.

original: Workers struggled as factories closed.
translated: Les travailleurs luttaient tandis que les usines fermaient.

original: Nancy has been on good terms with my sister for more than five years.
translated: Nancy a été en bons termes avec ma sœur pendant plus de cinq ans.

original: We'll prevail.
translated: Nous l'emporterons.

original: Don't worry. I'll stay with you.
translated: Ne t'en fais pas, je suis à tes côtés.

original: Tom started dreaming.
translated: Tom a commencé à rêver.

original: Bread and butter are my usual breakfast.
translated: Mon petit déjeuner se compose habituellement de pain et de beurre.

original: They've washed your dog.
translated: Elles lavèrent ton chien.

original: Judging from his appearance, he may be a soldier.
translated: D'après son apparence, il est peut-être militaire.

original: This is shameful.

original: The lifeguards are here to protect us.
translated: Les sauveteurs sont là pour nous protéger.

original: There was no one to stop Tom.
translated: Il n'y avait personne pour arrêter Tom.

original: We're studying French and web design.
translated: Nous étudions le français et la conception de sites web.

original: Knock when going to the bathroom, OK?
translated: Frappe avant d'entrer dans la salle de bains, d'accord ?

original: I'm going to see them again.
translated: Je vais les revoir.

original: Tom spent the whole morning getting ready for his presentation.
translated: Tom a passé toute la matinée à se préparer pour sa présentation.

original: In her grief, she burst into tears.
translated: Dans sa douleur, elle fondit en larmes.

original: Does it work?

original: I really need you.
translated: J'ai vraiment besoin de toi.

original: You've got to be bold!

original: Could it be that simple?

original: You cannot drive because you have drunk.
translated: Tu ne peux pas conduire car tu as bu.

original: Don't look at me!
translated: Ne me regarde pas !

original: Let us forget this problem.
translated: Oublions ce problème.

original: She absolutely trounces me whenever we play Scrabble.
translated: Elle me bat à plate couture chaque fois que nous jouons au Scrabble.

original: Use your head!
translated: Utilise ta tête !

original: Do you want another one of these?
translated: Voulez-vous encore l'un de ceux-ci ?

original: There are fifty stars on the American flag.
translated: Le drapeau des USA a cinquante étoiles.

original: Our team lost, 2-0.
translated: Notre équipe a perdu deux à zéro.

original: I am happy that you are my friend.
translated: Je suis content que tu sois mon amie.

original: Do you meet him often?
translated: Le rencontres-tu souvent ?

original: Mom, I'm hungry.
translated: Maman, j'ai faim.

original: I think I'd better do that now.
translated: Je pense que je ferais mieux de faire ça maintenant.

translated: Pourquoi vouliez-vous nous parler ?

original: After a long investigation, the police finally captured the suspected arsonist.
translated: Après une longue enquête, la police a enfin arrêté l'incendiaire présumé.

original: Hey, where did you two come from?
translated: Eh, d'où êtes-vous venues, toutes les deux ?

original: I'm not sure what my children want for Christmas.
translated: Je ne suis pas sûr de ce que mes enfants veulent pour Noël.

original: I'm concerned for my kids.
translated: Je suis inquiète pour mes enfants.

original: You're making me blush.
translated: Vous me faites rougir.

original: There's nothing on TV.
translated: Il n'y a rien à la téloche.

original: She uncrossed her legs.
translated: Elle a décroisé les jambes.

original: She wears a lot of makeup.
translated: Elle porte beaucoup de maquillage.

original: I was made to sing in public.
translated: Je suis fait pour chanter en public.

original: Don't get carried away.
translated: Ne t'emballe pas.

original: We sat in the very back of the auditorium.
translated: Nous nous sommes assis au fond de l'auditorium.

original: I'm fair.
translated: Je suis juste.

original: They're coming towards me.
translated: Ils viennent dans ma direction.

original: Owls are active at night.
translated: Les chouettes sont actives la nuit.

original: I've never been sedated before.
translated: Je n'ai jamais été anesthésié auparavant.

original: Walk every day.
translated: Promène-toi chaque jour.

original: Could you help me?
translated: Pouvais-tu m’aider ?

original: They're expressing their love by hugging.
translated: Ils expriment leur amour en s'enlaçant.

original: I want a word with you.
translated: Je veux avoir un mot avec vous.

original: I don't believe this is really happening.
translated: Je ne parviens pas à croire que ça se produise réellement.

original: Isn't that Tom's hat?
translated: N'est-ce pas le chapeau de Tom ?

original: I know who it is you're looking for.
translated: Je sais qui vous recherchez.

original: You know very well what I want.
translated: Tu sais très bien ce que je veux.

original: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
translated: Seuls les morts ont vu la fin de la guerre.

original: I'm plowing the soil.
translated: Je laboure le sol.

original: Wait a little longer.
translated: Attendez encore un peu !

original: Transhumance can also be an international manifestation of lucid peasants who resist the dictates of the administration.
translated: La transhumance peut aussi être une manifestation internationale de paysans lucides qui résistent aux dictats de l'administration.

original: Where are the showers?
translated: Où sont les douches ?

original: He is on the Internet.
translated: Il est sur Internet.

original: I saw you in the park yesterday.
translated: Je t'ai vue dans le parc, hier.

original: The largest muscle in the human body is the gluteus maximus.
translated: Le plus gros muscle du corps humain est le grand fessier.

original: I brought you a gift.
translated: Je t'ai amené un cadeau.

original: Women generally live longer than men.
translated: Les femmes vivent généralement plus longtemps que les hommes.

original: Her son will succeed for sure.
translated: Son fils est certain de réussir.

original: I understand what you say.
translated: Je comprends ce que vous dites.

original: Let me take a gander.
translated: Laisse-moi jeter un œil.

original: Women hate me.
translated: Les femmes me détestent.

original: I promise you I'll explain everything later.
translated: Je vous promets que j'expliquerai tout plus tard.

original: The income from this source is tax-free.
translated: Cette source de revenus est exemptée de taxes.

original: I'm already ready.
translated: Je suis déjà prêt.

original: Why couldn't you come on Saturday?
translated: Pourquoi ne pouvais-tu pas venir samedi ?

original: Oh, how we laughed!
translated: Oh, comme nous avons ri !

original: That's not like you.
translated: Ça ne vous ressemble pas.

original: His face reflects joy.
translated: Son visage exprime la joie.

original: Does he like me?
translated: M'aime-t-il ?

original: Sometimes things that happen do not make sense.
translated: Parfois, les choses qui arrivent sont dénuées de sens.

original: The fall from the ledge shattered his leg.
translated: Il s'est brisé la jambe en tombant de la corniche.

original: My uncle has a farm in the village.
translated: Mon oncle a une ferme dans le village.

original: That's me.
translated: C'est moi.

original: You're sure about this, right?
translated: Vous êtes sûre de ceci, n'est-ce pas ?

original: Please fill in this form.
translated: S'il vous plaît, remplissez ce formulaire.

original: Will you take me there?
translated: M'y emmèneras-tu ?

original: He read the poem with a loud voice.
translated: Il lut le poème à voix haute.

original: Tom agreed to be here at 2:30, but he's not here yet.
translated: Tom a consenti à être là à 2:30, mais il ne l'est pas encore.

original: Tom wrote a letter to Santa.
translated: Tom a écrit une lettre au Père Noël.

original: They are not telling us the truth.
translated: Elles ne nous disent pas la vérité.

original: I am so sick.
translated: Je suis si malade.

original: You don't have to pay.
translated: Ils ne font pas payer.

original: If you want to put your banner on my site, just send me the code.
translated: Si vous voulez mettre votre bannière sur mon site, envoyez-moi juste le code.

original: I got hurt while running.
translated: Je me suis fait mal en courant.
